chunks.text: going on in individuals' health,  in the health of a population, in the operations of a health  care system.  So they're very much into this.  Now, historically, I look back, and it

chunks.text: turns out there's something called the London  Bills of Mortality in the 17th century,  started by a gentleman named John Grant.  And he was interested just in figuring out  how long do people live?

chunks.title: part.005.mp3

chunks.title: part.005.mp3
